Plot ridgeline density distributions by group

Source: R/visualization.R
plot_ridgeline.Rd

Creates a ridgeline (joy) plot showing the density distribution of a numeric score across groups, with jittered data points overlaid. Useful for comparing score distributions across variant consequence categories.

Usage

plot_ridgeline(
  data,
  score_col,
  group_col,
  consequences = default_consequences,
  colours = consequence_colours,
  xlab = score_col,
  ylab = "Density",
  point_shape = "|",
  point_size = 3,
  alpha = 0.7
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the score and grouping columns.

score_col

Character. Name of the column containing the numeric scores to plot on the x-axis.

group_col

Character. Name of the column containing the grouping variable (e.g., consequence type) for the y-axis ridges.

consequences

Character vector. Only include rows where the group_col value is in this vector. The factor levels of the grouping variable will be set to this order. Set to NULL to include all groups without filtering (default: default_consequences).

colours

Named character vector of fill colours keyed by group values (default: consequence_colours).

xlab

Character. X-axis label (default: value of score_col).

ylab

Character. Y-axis label (default: "Density").

point_shape

Shape for jittered points (default: "|").

point_size

Size for jittered points (default: 3).

alpha

Ridge fill transparency (default: 0.7).

Value

A ggplot object.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
plot_ridgeline(
  data = results,
  score_col = "adj_score_condition_Day7_vs_Day4",
  group_col = "slim_consequence"
)

# With specific consequences in a custom order
plot_ridgeline(
  data = results,
  score_col = "adj_score_condition_Day7_vs_Day4",
  group_col = "slim_consequence",
  consequences = c("synonymous", "missense", "stop_gained"),
  xlab = "z-score (Day7 vs Day4)",
  ylab = "Consequence"
)
} # }
